questions.question: Who defined Economics as a ‘science which studies human behaviour as a relationship between ends and scarce means which have alternative uses’?
questions.explanation: Lionel Robbins gave this influential scarcity‑based definition in his 1932 book 'An Essay on the Nature and Significance of Economic Science.'

questions.question: A mixed economy is characterized by the co‑existence of __________.
questions.explanation: A mixed economy combines private enterprise with substantial government intervention and public ownership in certain sectors.

questions.question: Which of the following is an assumption of the law of demand?
options: Price of the commodity should not change
Quantity of the commodity should not change
Supply of the commodity should not change
Income of consumer should not change
questions.explanation: The law of demand holds ceteris paribus—other factors like consumer income, tastes, and prices of related goods are assumed constant.

questions.question: If quantity demanded is completely unresponsive to changes in price, demand is ________.
questions.explanation: Perfectly inelastic demand means quantity demanded does not change at all when price changes; the demand curve is vertical.
